segment.source: How to Sequence a New Application Package Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Sequence a New Application Package Using the Command Line

segment.source: How to Sequence a New Application Package Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Sequence a New Application Package Using the Command Line

segment.source: How to Sequence a New Application Package Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Sequence a New Application Package Using the Command Line

segment.source: You can use a command line to sequence a new application.
segment.target: You can use a command line to sequence a new application.

segment.source: Using a command line is useful when you have to create a large number of virtual applications or when you need to create sequenced applications on a recurring basis.
segment.target: Using a command line is useful when you have to create a large number of virtual applications or when you need to create sequenced applications on a recurring basis.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Command-line sequencing allows for default sequencing only.
segment.target: Command-line sequencing allows for default sequencing only.

segment.source: If you need to change default installation settings for the application you are sequencing, you must either manually modify the virtual application or update the virtual application by using the Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer.
segment.target: If you need to change default installation settings for the application you are sequencing, you must either manually modify the virtual application or update the virtual application by using the Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer.

segment.source: For more information about updating a virtual application by using the App-V Sequencer, see How to Upgrade an Existing Virtual Application.
segment.target: For more information about updating a virtual application by using the App-V Sequencer, see How to Upgrade an Existing Virtual Application.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to create a virtual application by using the command line.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to create a virtual application by using the command line.

segment.source: To sequence an application by using the command line
segment.target: To sequence an application by using the command line

segment.source: On the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, open the command prompt by selecting Start, Run, and then type cmd.
segment.target: On the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, open the command prompt by selecting Start, Run, and then type cmd.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Use the command prompt to specify the location of where the App-V Sequencer is installed.
segment.target: Use the command prompt to specify the location of where the App-V Sequencer is installed.

segment.source: For example, at the command prompt, you could type the following: cd C:Program FilesMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: For example, at the command prompt, you could type the following: cd C:Program FilesMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: At the command prompt, type the following command, replacing the text in quotation marks with your values:
segment.target: At the command prompt, type the following command, replacing the text in quotation marks with your values:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can specify additional parameters by using the command line, depending on the complexity of the application you are sequencing.
segment.target: You can specify additional parameters by using the command line, depending on the complexity of the application you are sequencing.

segment.source: For a complete list of parameters that are available for use with the App-V Sequencer, see Application Virtualization Sequencer Command Line.
segment.target: For a complete list of parameters that are available for use with the App-V Sequencer, see Application Virtualization Sequencer Command Line.

segment.source: Use the value descriptions in the following table to help you determine the actual text you will use in the preceding command.
segment.target: Use the value descriptions in the following table to help you determine the actual text you will use in the preceding command.

segment.source: Value
segment.target: Value

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: pathtoMSI
segment.target: pathtoMSI

segment.source: Specifies the Windows Installer or a batch file that will be used to install an application so that it can be sequenced.
segment.target: Specifies the Windows Installer or a batch file that will be used to install an application so that it can be sequenced.

segment.source: pathtopackageroot
segment.target: pathtopackageroot

segment.source: Specifies the package root directory.
segment.target: Specifies the package root directory.

segment.source: pathtodestinationSPRJ
segment.target: pathtodestinationSPRJ

segment.source: Specifies the path and file name of the SPRJ file that will be created.
segment.target: Specifies the path and file name of the SPRJ file that will be created.

segment.source: Press Enter.
segment.target: Press Enter.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: How to Manage Virtual Applications Using the Command Line
